Vagante is a Binding of Isaac equivalent for Spelunky. A much darker. MUCH more mechanically deep. And can be A LOT more fun. While I haven't played multiplayer yet I believe if I am having as much fun as I am now I'll have even more with friends.

38601528.review:
This game is good, like really really good! Everything from its crushing difficulty, to the lack of any type of story! Its amazing how such a small team could make such a great game! SO let me quick list pros and cons for people who are reading this review.


               ::PROS::
-VERY diffcult
-Interesting Areas
-Pixel art, though overdone, is very nice in this game
-Multiplayer to play with your friends, whether its local or online
-Great soundtrack  (shoutouts to the forest and rift fight themes)
-Great, although small, playerbase
-Updates are large and full of bug fixes
-Wide variety of enemies! (AKA no reskins)
-New Game+ is always nice
-Satisfying gameplay
-Multiple Classes each with their own unique abilities...except rogue....I'll get to her in a minute...

               ::CONS::
-The only reward **really** after dying is the increase in your skill
-Overhead swing weapons aren't class specific. Meaning that you have no character bonuses making them hard to use
-Now onto the Rogue... This character is basically a Jack Of All Trades. This specific character is overpowered as hell! Everything from the Dodgeroll to the ability to move with the bow. The Rogue has the greatest variety of skills and can successfully shoot and dagger his way to victory. This may have been the intentional, but once you start dodgerolling then shooting arrows you have this slight taste of this greater moveset this character could have had. Or more importantly how every other character is lacking in tactical moves... Not even to mention how powerful an endgame rogue's bow is! To really understand what I mean you'll need to play as the Rogue.
-Saving feature is not really something I've seen anyone use
-An utter lack of healing items. This game is meant to be difficult but being thrown a bone would be nice.
-A small playerbase, though good in some areas, means that the online lobbies are generally empty.
-No type of ingame guide to monsters(You can't see monsters' stats for example)
-Small development team means updates are few and far betwee, meaning that the game(after it's been beaten) fails to hold my attention
-Cooking is underutilized
-Act 3 is a difficulty spike, and Act 4, though freakin awesome, is a cakewalk afterwards..sometimes
-Unspoken prerequisites, what I mean is that you "need" certain abilities for certain Acts or else its extremely difficult lemme quick list (im not covering the secret acts, although they are the worst offenders. I wish that the levels reflected their main elements better) :
          ACT 1: You fumble around getting pwned until you get to Act 2
          ACT 2: Although possible without. It is extremely difficult without poison resistance
          ACT 3: You fumble around getting pwned until you get to Act 4
          ACT 4: What? No boulder protection? You're screwed without it
-The game is dark, and not in a good way...
-Artifacts are cryptic, This may have been the point. But I hate looking on the wiki for how to get some of these
                ::NITPICKS::
-The full soundtrack isn't available without going through your game files
-Shops are useless in the endgame
-Mentioned this already, but Swing weapons don't have place with any character's abilities

      I know that there are more cons than pros, but I criticize because I fucking love this game, I highly HIGHLY recommend it

38050035.review:
It's simple but tough, and it's very addicting, although the game's been in early access for a seemingly long while, but I'm not complaining since the team has been making some good updates and fixes on the game as well as balance in the classes (i.e. Knight used to start with pogostick so he had instagib abilities like Berserker Wildling early on).

There's a lot of items and different classification of items like Blue, Orange, and the glowing Purple for how good and rare they are. The rarity of these items match well with expectations of the item, [spoiler] like the Celtic Ring which can reveal ALL hidden enemies in each level. [/spoiler] Some of the items however, like the Mace, Warhammer, Battleaxe and those other misc. weapons are decent but it doesn't really fit any class and acts more as a "substitute" weapon for anything (like having Lifesteal on a Mace so you can switch to the Mace to regain bits of health before going to the next level).

The monsters are especially amazing and they all have their subtly unique counterparts, like the Ghouls and the Archers in the forest, while some of them are completely new like the crawling hands in the Catacombs. None of the normal monsters seem to be overpowered and they all have their own strengths and weaknesses which you can easily exploit or literally pulverize your way through.

The bosses are pretty good, but for me it just seems like the Catacombs bosses are [b]E X T R E M E[/b] OP. I was having a hard time fighting the abomination with tendrils and flesh orbs, especially the zombie dragon with maxed Berserker and Fist Weapons using this other fist weapon that looked like knuckles (forgot what they were called), and I was rapidly punching and spamming X but my Death Protection got used and I died before it died and I got a bunch of 8-12 and occasional 23 dmg crits on the boss. Although, I can't really say this is the game's issue but personal since they are SUPPOSED to be harder as the levels progress, I just felt like the only boss I could kill was the Sorcerer.

The level designs are randomly generated, which is always nice, and even some of the levels will literally try to kill you immediately by spawning in spikes with an arrow trap above you or having a boss blocking the only way to progress through the level, or something crazy, and for me personally, even the Catacombs with those PRESSURE SPIKES (although this could be avoided with Light Feet) and bosses. But overall, level design is amazing, it never gets boring.

Also is a GREAT experience with multiplayer, but every player does start out with 20 less max HP than in solo because, multiplayer at 100 or 80 HP start is just not okay. The only issue I have with MP is teamkilling by THROWING BOXES, BARRELS, AND CRATES at your teammates and literally just getting them killed. I don't know if it's intentional or not but it's kind of annoying.

As far as the game goes with level progression (character-wise), every ability when unlocking them holds some real significance like Wildling's animal stance level 1 can give you some breathing room, Rogue acrobatics can let you easily steal from the merchant and dodge if paired with Stealth. Killing bosses is always rewarded with a garunteed level progression, but it does not stack on top of the experience you gain the next level, or in other words, you can only gain 1 character level in each level, so you're not constantly getting 2-3 levels and becoming an overpowered beast that's obliterating everyone's innards into outards. 

[b]TOO LONG DIDN'T READ[/b]
[b]tl;dr This game is an amazing, simple, but tough platformer with unique monsters and bosses. You can play it alone, or you can play it with friends which makes it all the more better. Level design is good, but can improve by not trying to trap and destroy the player's chances (but rarely does it happen). You will die a lot, but you will learn a lot in the process as well and you're also going to struggle with choices such as, "should I really go for that boss I keep dying to, even though I already mopped the level up for a character level?" or "should I save my key for the next level's chest, or use it now to maximize my profits at best?"[/b]

I'd give it a solid 9/10, amazing and addicting game, but small things [strike]like the Catacombs[/strike] could use some fixing and improvement.

37834063.review:
This is a beautiful little game. It's deceptively simple but almost impossible to master, and with enough complexity that it has extraordinary replayability. The different character classes are all unique with their own starting equipment, stats, and abilities, which allows for a wide variety of play styles. Want to run around all the enemies and attack from a distance? Be an acrobatic rogue and roll, jump, and climb around to your hearts content. Want to just brute force melee everything? Be a berserker wildling and solve all of your problems with fists. Finding a method that works for you is important because the game can be mind numbingly difficult. 

The games mechanics are very classic rpg and rogue-like: simple melee, ranged, and magic attacks with stats that control each; a variety of potions, scrolls, and magic spells; and a plethora of different weapons, armor, and gear, most of which has some sort of magic property. However, the most notable feature that makes it a classic rogue-like is that preserving health is critical. If you're not careful you can lose a lot of health fast, and healing is infrequent. In addition, the enemies get much harder with each subsequent stage, even relative to any stat boosts from leveling up and better gear. This is why after over 500 hours of play time logged and a death count in the thousands, I've beaten the game exactly three times. 

However, skill is only about three quarters of having a successful run, and the rest is luck. The randomness of the loot can be one of the most challenging aspects of the game. Skill is critically important: just through muscle memory, good reflexes, and learning the attack patterns of the enemies, it should theoretically be possibly to beat the game with no gear and unarmed. That being said, better gear make the game infinitely easier. Besides boosting your stats, one of the most interesting aspects of the gear system are the magic properties of the items. Most weapons and armor have some sort of magic property, the effects of which range from detrimental (such as cursed items, although the curse can be lifted, or super speed boots, which make it nearly impossible to have any sort of precision to your movement), to useless or niche (such as underwater breathing, or heavy boots), to helpful (such as double or triple jump, dealing additional poison or fire damage, or having a familiar that fights with you). There are also some that are ridiculously over powered or way more useful. Things like life steal and homing arrows make the game a breeze, but are proportionally rarer. 

Co-op is fantastic with this game, and while I haven't played much online, my roommate and I play couch co-op all the time. It is a little easier with more people, although starting stats and health are slightly nerfed when playing with more than one person to make it more balanced, and the quantity of loot stays the same and must be split amongst the party.  

It's hard not to keep raving about this game. It's strange to me to think that I've put so much time into such a simple game, but the simplicity is part of the appeal. Everything about it is so minimal and uncluttered, while retaining and refining to a point the things that make a great rogue-like. The developers have done an amazing job with this game and keeping it updated. The next update should be the end game content and the game will move out of early access. I can't wait to see what they do, and hopefully the official release will expose more people to this game.

36337311.review:
we need chinese!!!
这款游戏在愿望单第一的位子摆了一个多月，终于忍不住入坑。到现在还是没有汉化，只好努力边查单词边玩游戏。买下一周就已经玩了30+小时。
我个人很喜欢这款游戏，很喜欢法师游侠这类职业设定的游戏。一条命的确有点难，每次死了心里都有点失落。特别是不小心掉到地刺上，我心里像吃了屎一样难受。
还好有在线多人，可以宿舍四个人一起玩，死了还可以变成骷髅继续帮忙。过关了还能在篝火的墓碑那里复活队友。专门拯救我这个手残党。
这种打boos拿钥匙爆装备的设定我超级喜欢。各种装备不仅有属性加成，有一些甚至有厉害的效果（死亡保护真的太棒了）。一边通关一边成长，还有和伙伴一起冒险合作。（拿箱子砸队友真的有趣）
游戏本身四个职业：骑士 游侠 法师 野蛮人 加上技能不一样的加点方向，玩法还是蛮多的。
听说有四大关卡，每个关卡三个小图一个小图一个boss。似乎通关了以后还可以用通关人物二刷，还是很耐玩的。目前我只到第三关墓穴，死活过不去。不知道天空长什么样子的。
手残没有攻略，讲一下设置
    嫌地图暗的，在setting设置里面，打开enable shader开启渲染，这样可以在第三栏调节亮度啦。
    玩法师的，在skill栏，下面选quick cycling 再选D-cast 再点右边con。。。那个，就可以给法术设置快捷键啦。（强烈建议官方给法师多几个技能快捷键，只有四栏真的少）
    多人合作注意，只有血量高于20才能救人。本地合作时默认一个人玩，要在control里面点player2，然后点enable player2，再选手柄或者键盘才可以一起玩。
    刚开始不能进山洞，要去右边先过了新手教程，才能进山洞开始游戏。
    英文不怎么懂的话，去这个吧的精品贴，里面有一些过时但也能看的翻译。
   如果官方能够看到的话，希望你们能在新手教程里面介绍一下各种祭台神像的用法。还有，目前两个献祭的盆子太像了，配色能不能区分更明显一些？
最后祝大家玩得开心！比心！

35894310.review:
Pros:
-Genuinely good pixel art that isn't low effort indie trash
-Steady updates and bug fixes
-New content every now and then
-Online and local multiplayer that work well (until your ping is over 150ish)
-Gameplay is solid and movement is fluid, most attacks can be dodged
-Each class has unique skills
-Multiple bosses for the four areas in the game, each area has a side path with a secret item and boss

Cons:
-Some traps are instakill, falling out of map bounds is instakill, some monsters can instakill by falling on you
-Playing solo can be quite diffuclt unless you're very good at the game
-No real ending currently, it just loops you through the areas again at a harder difficulty

Owned the game since august 2015. If you can find friends to play with, or it goes on sale if ever, it's worth picking up.

Do I recommend this game? Sort of. it's a great game, no, fantastic. However, I have my reasons why I sort of advice to step away, however if you love rogue likes or you're looking for a great split screen game, this is for you.

Pros:
4 classes, one being unlocked, 4 skins for each and a ton of perks to choose from.
4 worlds, 3 levels, 2 soundtracks for each world, when unlocked
SPLIT SCREEN CO-OP!!
Online as well
Lots of unlockables
[spoiler] When beaten, although there is no cutscene or anything special, you get to re-do the game with your current stats, and weapons, with harder enemies, and loads more of them.	[/spoiler]
Very rewarding when you learn how to play
Cons:
(This is a big one) Game has been out for YEARS, and it's still in early access stage, game still feels the same, aside from a few new things.
Wildling is SO broken, 
Weapons don't have that feeling when you really don't want to part ways with it, no special things to them that will make you feel attached.
Special challenge rooms have no advantage to using them.

Overall I give it a 7.5/10, just wish it finally came out of early access.

34894234.review:
This is probably one of the more hidden gems on steam as I see it. The game features roguelike elements, mixing that in with 2D platforming mechanics. The combat is fast paced, movement is precise, and the RNG is offset by a demand for skill rather than luck. Your gear still determines how easy you really have it, but if you want to make it far and beat the game you'll need to hone your skills with the mechanics. I like that personally, it's a different take on the roguelike genre and this game in particular executes that very well.

It's a game that knows what it wants to be, and is almost complete. As I see it, this is definitely worth picking up if you're up to a challenge and a breath of fresh air in the roguelike genre. I wholeheartedly recommend this game. 9/10

34889107.review:
Достаточно много времени уже потратил на эту игру... больше полутора лет, с разной степенью интенсивности...
И всю дорогу в голове свербила мысль: "КОГДА ВЫ УЖЕ ЕЁ ДОПИЛИТЕ!?" Серьёзно, пусть проект со временем и избавляется от целого ряда технических недочётов, но даже спустя весь период нашего с ней знакомства, игра выглядела сырой.
И это, конечно, сильно портило впечатление, ведь столь необычный и вместе с тем до боли знакомый ещё со времён 8битной эпохи игровой процесс всё равно вполне себе способен приносить удовольствие.
При всей своей кажущейся внешней незатейливости, нельзя сказать, что игра простая... никак нельзя... Vagante - действительно сложная игра, где нужно буквально ценой собственных смертей учить условия тех или иных локаций и их обитателей (в частности, боссов).
Кроме того, в первую очередь игра рассчитана на кооп - пройти её одному (да даже вдвоём, как оказалось) нереально. Ну или это должен быть какой-то запредельный скилл уровня ЦАРЬ.
Сейчас, глядя, как мы с товарищем "горели" от очередного загубленного по неосторожности захода, на самом деле, даже начинаешь мило воздыхать по тем часам, проведенным в подземельях и джунглях.
Игру мы так и не прошли, кстати, отложив её "в долгий ящик". Но всё равно, можно смело заявить, что Vagante, даже в своём незавершенном виде, сейчас - игра, обладающая атмосферой, которая, вкупе с интересным геймплеем и сложностью, способна вызывать интерес у достаточно широкой аудитории искушенных игроков.

34473163.review:
Let's break it down concisely.

Pros:

It's a roguelike ;)

The combat is clean and fair.

Each run feels fresh.

The single player seems almost like a fully-polished game.

Devs are active and the game is nearly done anything added would feel bonus other than the multiplayer.

The servers are amazing and has steam and non-steam play.

Cons: It's early access.

Decent learning curve. (not a con for most (or even me) just thought some would want to know if it was CASUL)

Can only save on single-player currently.

The price point may steer some away. 

The real fun comes from multi-play. Which is a positive and negative. I enjoy the multiplayer. Just waiting on the updates to roll in.

All in all. 8.5/10 The randomeness of encounters and enemy diversity feels less than some games of this genre. It makes up for these faults with its solid combat, deep leveling system, epic loots, and challenging boss battles. There are also many other secrets but those are always the most satisfying to find alone or in a party.

34464415.review:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie 

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

34443838.review:
The cheap instant deaths ruin this game for me. Playing 20+ runs in a row just to finally get a good run, have a great build, manage to beat that boss you died 3 times today. Then enter a new dungeon and get 999 damage out of nowhere while exploring. 

 The way it is now, you have to be a mazochist to enjoy this game. Because if you start having fun, you are going to die. The further you go and the better you build, the more scared you get about the cheap deaths and losing everything because you got unlucky and didnt pay attention for 5 seconds. 

 Learning to avoid each surprise and watch for every 2pixel sized triggers for the traps was ok for the first dungeon. You get to start over there if you die. But doing the same for the 3rd 4th dungeons is just plain chore because even if you play a certain level 100 times you can't breeze throught it because of the cheap instadeaths from the very first seconds of your run.  

 I like this game, the combat is different, the enemies are fun once you get used to them. But the cheapness of the traps never stops being cheap and ruins the whole experience.

 I hope the developer will at least ad an option to disable instadeaths for people who just want to enjoy the combat. Until then, i don't recommend it to people unless they really want to punish themselves constanly in hope to have some fun at some point of the game.

33919455.review:
This is truely fantastic game. At it's core it's a "metroidvania" roguelike, with an appropriatly steep learning curve and the obligitory no-extra-lives, death = restart Roguelike mechanics. Also, via it's roguelike roots, it has proceedurally generated dungeons, enemies, and item drops. What makes this such a fun experience is the way the items are implimented; the gear you aquire doesn't just contribute to a pool of bonuses and modifiers; many of them are truely game-changing in nature, totally changing the way you fight and traverse the level, sometimes in very unexpected ways. This has the effect of softening the blow of restarting after death, in that you'll still be excited as to what your next run will bring. Its four classes also bring with them a diverse set of unique playstyles which keep things fresh even after dozens of hours of play. 

10/10. Don't pass this one up.

33576908.review:
I got this game very early into development. I've stacked quite a few hours into multiplayer with my brother and friends and have watched it grow. The developer has regularly come out with updates and it has grown quite quickly into a very good game that I have thoroughly enjoyed. This is early access done right. It is now climbing towards 1.0 and I felt the need to give a review.

This game is brutal and unforgiving in single player, while multiplayer allows for the possibility of revival. It is very roguelike at its core. Death is the end, and it comes easy. However, I find the difficulty to not be very frustrating. After I die, which is practically inevitable, I am eager to begin again and see how far I can go.

Bosses are difficult, until you start to figure out their patterns. Some bosses will remain difficult, even if you do know the patterns. Difficulty also very much depends on the luck of the draw when it comes to loot, but that is half the fun! Especially when you are rushing to get it before your friends.

The developer intends on working some balance issues out in the future, which I believe is needed. The wildling is horribly underpowered right now, while the rogue is perhaps the easiest way to progress through the levels.

Overall, this game is wonderful. It has come a long way from when I first bought it. I would highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys a difficult game.

33410888.review:
Great little game. Great music, art, and, most importantly, gameplay. I can highly recommend Vagante at its current price and level of development, and I hope to see more and more content being added regularly.

The online is pretty cool too, and making use of the Vagante Discord server and steam allows for great interactions with other players. I'd love to see the community and player base grow so finding an online game is easier. I finished this game with some other people pretty quickly (they were really  good and helped me through), but I think the game has enough replay value to keep me coming back to it even after a "full play through". 

There are 4 classes (3 of which are available straight off the bat) and the random generation of the game makes each play through a bit different. There is a fair variety of bosses and enemies, as well as items and abilities.

I do have one or two problems with the game, but those are fairly minor and I’d recommend the game despite of them.

Again, if you buy this, it is advisable to join the game's unofficial discord becasue the playerbase is small and therefore finding unorganised games is very difficult and the multiplayer is definitely worth playing.

32774086.review:
20時間ほど2～4人で協力プレイを遊んだ感想。
まず、役割分担と慎重さが求められるゲームである。

装備区分がかぶらないようにチーム構成を割当て、
テキストなりボイスチャットなりで予めどういったトラブルにどう対処するかを相談し決めておく。
そうすることで、突発的な事故を防ぎながらじりじりと先へ進む。

アイテムはガンガン手に入るが、4人カバーするほどは落ちない。
だから、不公平になりづらいように気を配る必要がある。
前衛が一人で大丈夫と思えてしまう場面も多いが、一人死ぬと不思議と難易度が格段に上がる。

調子よく進むと必ずと行っていい程ミスをする。だので、情報共有がとても大切。
そういう意味では、普通のRPGよりよほどRPGしている感覚。
協力の大切さを味わう。


2時間ほど、1人でプレイした感想。
ボスや雑魚は戦略を立てると、難易度が激減する。

主に地形を活かしたり、予め魔法を入手しておくなど。
非常に準備が大切で、慌てず淡々とタスクをこなし、
雑魚を1匹ずつ処理し、ゆっくり確実に進んでいく。

そして、調子がいいと感じて勇み足になると、
ふっとした調子で罠で死んだり、足を滑らせて死んだりする。
慎重さを失ったときが死の瞬間。


1回のプレイ時間は10分～1時間くらいだけど、
マップ攻略中の緊張感と、探索/荷物整理中の安心感、
それに付随するストレス落差を楽しむ、そんな感じのゲームだと思いました。
個人的にはとても気に入っています。難易度はすごく高いですけど。
上達が味わえる感じがとても良いですね。

[h1]ファンタジーでやる。Spelunkyをやる。[/h1]

このゲームは、相当な部分でSpelunkyをリスペクトしている。
自動生成のダンジョンは一発死も起こりうるような罠、自然環境に恵まれている。
アクションゲームなのに知識ゲー的側面というか、例えば「針の罠があるか確認する為に、敵の死体を先に投げる」（これはSpelunkyでも似たようなテクニックがある）とかそういう感じの
知っているからこそ出来るサバイバル術みたいなのがもうわんさかある。
操作方法・マップ生成・UIに至るまで、だいたい参考にされているかと思います。

んじゃSpelunkyでええやんけ、ではないんです。
このゲームはそのうえで、がっつりファンタジーをしている。
このファンタジー度合いがとてもよろしい。D&DとかGURPSとかロードス島とか
なんかそういう感じのファンタジーを匂わせる、ちょっとアダルティーなやつよ。

VIT依存の最大HPとか、好きやろ？
職業ごとにレベルアップで開放される[b]武器種限定の[/b]武器スキル、好きやろ？
そして、今で言うダークソウルズライク？敵死にゲー。好きやろ？
確定されたダメージ回復手段はステージ間の焚き火（つっても回復は10くらい）のみ。
いかにダメージ喰らわずに行くか、ってのがもうキリキリ胃が痛い。

でも遊びやすさもかなり意識されてて
MPとかいうややこしいものはなくて、魔法は使用回数のあるやつもかなり緩めだし無限に使えるとかそんなんばっかり。
また、精確な数字はわからないが体感でかなりレア（エンチャント）アイテム・使えるアイテムが出やすい。

特にアイテムの引きありきのゲームになっていない点はものすごく評価に値する。
そりゃいいアイテムが引けりゃいいけど、まぁまぁ出るんで最初の何ステージで決まるようなもんでなくて
ガンガン掘っていける感じ。
まぁでもステージが進むとかなりダメージ出せるようになっていないとやっぱりどうしようもないんだけど。

Spelunkyは名作だ。
しかしそこにこれだけのテーマを載せることで、そしてシステムの細部まで気を使うことで
あれだけのアクションゲームを完璧なRPG作品にアレンジしてしまった。
ただのガワ違いじゃなくて、全く別のリ・アレンジ。
Spelunkyは一発死に怯えるアクションゲーム。
Vaganteはファンタジー世界の冒険を楽しめるゲーム。細かい数値、スキルセット、そして強大な敵を打ち倒しルートを楽しむ。

拍手しかないわ。買い。

32646274.review:
A good looking and tight controlled Rogue-like with decent amounts of environmental randomization, a nice pool of unique items and basic Role-Playing leveling mechanics.

Overpriced considering the low amount of randomization as a whole, the very poor developer support and straight up broken controller support. The game also likes killing players instantly with traps that are barely visible, perhaps the developers are underaged. The only unique strength of the game is it actually has online co-op.

It still suffers from the primary issues of these kinds of low-end Rogue-like games; it does not have enough randomization or polish to compete with the price range it is sold in. There are multiple other Rogue-likes you could buy which are better designed and hold far more replayability then this one while costing exactly the same. It doesn't help how awkward the combat can be as well, while the controls are tight in a very satisfying way; the actual method in which players need to land hits using melee is straight up clumsy and unrefined.


It's also to be noted how blatantly the game rips off the mechanics of Spelunky. If the developers were so desperate to save brain power by just stealing another games system instead of making up their own; where did they put all that saved energy into. Because it certainly didn't get put to use in making anything in this game remotely special or innovative, or polished in any way.

32508562.review:
[TL;DR] Superb game. Highly recommend.

The Rogue-Like elements are done well. You will recognise areas after a while, but the structure and placement methods keep the same areas feeling different for each run. Though the levels can feel a bit short at times, they are always interesting to navigate and explore.
Combat is satisfying. Button mashing will get you killed, but properly executed tactics are rewarding. In 78 hours of gameplay (at time of writing) I have rarely felt like a death was cheap. Every hit taken, or missed attack is down to my own error, not glitchy hitboxes/mechanics.
Character diversity doesn't feel limited by the chosen class. The, current four, classes each have their own perks, but there is no pressure to play a specific way or use a certain weapon.
Item diversity. Though the selection of weapons may seem limited, compared to other games, the balance actually works in the game's favour. Going for a handful of architype weapons, with stronger varients, and a veriety of enchants means you are more likely to find the weapon you want but you are not guarenteed the stats you want.
My few complaints with the game are so minor, I am not going to bother highlighting them, as they will likely be resolved before full release.

This is a roguelike with some RPG/character building elements. I would not suggest trying to play it without a controller of some sort. (I use an Xbone controller)

Yes, it has RNG like crazy. Yes, deaths can be very frustrating because of being knocked into traps or from a very far height. Yes, it has been in Early Access for a long time. Yes there are apparently very sparse bugs. The difficulty in the beginning can be difficult.
Not everything about this game is apparent or given in the tutorial. There are some functions (D-Casting for the mage, shrines, effects on armor and weapons) that you have to either wiki, look in discussions, or figure out.

HOWEVER, since I had this game gifted to me by a friend, I have fallen in love with it. I love the art direction. I love the multiplayer. The RNG can be frustrating at times, but it makes those good items extremely satisfying.
There could be some improvement on one or two of the classes skill trees but there are updates and bugfixes (I haven't encountered many bugs myself) fairly regularly from what I've seen.
The platforming is solid in the vein of Spelunky (I actually prefer Vagante to Spelunky for a few reasons). The item generation is in the ballpark of mixed Diablo and (if you played it) the mobile roguelike Pixel Dungeon.
The multiplayer is still populated (not extremely populated, but every time I've gone there is at least one game running. It helps to have friends who play too.)


[Edited lines ahead]
Having completed the availiable content somewhere between 70 and 80 hours, I've still played another 15ish hours and still like the game. The updates have become like three months or more apart. So idk if the game will ever be completed. There are talks of what the end game content is, and that it going to be implemented in the coming patch(es maybe?).
It's worth the price though.
I find this to be an extremely charming game.

32229483.review:
Vagante is my favorite game in the past five years.

On the surface, it's a punishing 2D roguelike platformer with simple and fluid combat mechanics; but at its heart, it's a stat-based, skill-tree-building rpg. The two elements combine to make one of the most enjoyable gaming experiences I know of.

A lot of people seem to dislike how punishing the game can be. For instance, you might spend 7 hours on a single run only to stumble into a spike trap and instantly die at full health. With perma-death, this is definitely frustrating. But in the age of the Quick Save, where any mistake in a game can be undone by reloading a save point from two minutes earlier, I think it's pretty exhilerating to play a game where actions have consequences.

Other people complain about the how you can have bad luck on a run and end up with bad items, low stats, and at a severe disadvantage.This is also something that happens, but again, I see this as a strength to the game rather than a shortcoming. If I got the ideal items every time and had the eprfect skill-tree, it wouldn't be much of an rpg... I might as well be playing any other 2D platformer.

Other reviews will discuss the excellent artwork and gameplay, but I just wanted to offer a counter to some of the negative comments. I think this game is worth double the price for people who like rpgs, and at least worth the standardprice for people who like platformers. :)

(Note: I have many more hours than my record shows. I played a lot of local multiplayer on my brother's account)

32003299.review:
After nearly 25 hours of playing Vagante, it seems funny that I can't recommend it. There are elements to this game that are unbelievably satisfying: Mastering the controls, building up your character from scratch, defeating the bosses, exploring the levels- this game takes much of what makes the rogue-like genre likable and turns it up. HOWEVER, this game suffers from another aspect of rogue-likes in too much of an extreme- that randomness has the ability to cripple and kill your character at any time with very little foresight or control from the player. Here's a few examples:

Traps
Reading through other reviews, traps get a lot of attention, and for good reason- there is no reason for a small misstep or bad RNG to kill a player immediately. While traps do encourage care from the player, the fact that elements outside of your control (Such as being knocked by enemies, or not being able to see an area below you) can immediately end the game is frustrating in the extreme. Traps can be fun, but not when so much of a player's success is dependent on something that can instantly kill you. If the penalty for traps was less brutal, I'm sure they would be fine, but as it stands, that's not the case.

Potions and Scrolls
Oh man. There's an issue with giving a player a huge toolbox but not letting them know what the tools are. In Vagante you find scrolls and potions, but (with some exception) unless you use them, you don't know what a certain color scroll or potion will do (and they change colors every game). While scrolls are generally positive, and using them can simply mean wasting an effect, potions are a serious gamble: poison potions can slowly kill you, and some potions will permanently reduce your stats. Knowing what your scrolls did in advance (because some scrolls can be used to identify other items and potions) would hugely reduce the random aspect of potions, but, again, that isn't how it stands. In most cases, you are left with a huge arsenal of potions and scrolls with little to do but let them take up your limited inventory space. 

Cursed and Negative Items
Similar issue to the potions and scrolls, but a little less extreme. Equipping a cursed item means you can't unequip it. Some items severely ruin your stats, making you extremely weak, or slow, or etc. etc. Why they wouldn't remove cursed items so that players could actively decide what tradeoffs they wanted to make with their items? I'm not sure, but it sucks. Cursed items is a lot less of a concern than other items on this list (being that they don't appear that often), but it's another un-fun element of gambling added to the mix. 

Difficulty Curve
In Vagante, you progress through a dungeon, a forest, a catacomb, and some sky islands. I truly believe that the first area of the game is the most fair- the enemies are predictable and simple, and they are never in overwhelming quantities or deal overwhelming amounts of damage. If you get hurt by these guys, you know it's you own fault. That's not at all the case with later enemies, who are in higher concentrations, deal more damage, take more damage, and worst- they can stun you or grab you with little warning. If the designers were looking for fairness, they might consider changing one of those variables at a time, but not all of them. While I imagine a more fair game would have a linear rising slope of challenge, the way it is now looks is like an exponential degree of difficulty.

Leveling Your Character
Vagante tries to make interesting tradeoffs in its designs: Do I pass up this enemy, and not get experience or gold? or do I fight this enemy, and risk taking damage? The thing is, most of the time it doesn't make sense to take on enemies, especially as the game goes on. If the only goal is to reach the end of the level, and the only thing preventing you from doing that is taking damage, why risk the additional dangers? An easy fix for this would be to force players to confront enemies before making it to the end of each level, but the game has no incentive to do so, especially with it's current imbalance in favor towards it's enemies. It's almost always better to just try and make it to the end than fight your way through.

I don't want to seem like I'm nitpicking, but these details are glaring flaws in an otherwise very strong game. I have enjoyed my time with Vagante, but there are too many poor design choices in the game for it to warrant any more of my time. Good games should implement elements of both luck and skill, but Vagante relies to heavily on the former than the latter.

31920051.review:
If this game had only been out a year I'd say this is an Early Access Review. But much like many games on steam, this game has been in Early Access for two and a half years. So this is just criticism for the designers of the game and those curious of this game's value. 

With that said, I do not recommend this game to gamers who are used to the quality of movement/mechanics of a game like Rogue Legacy or recently Dead Cells. 

Vagante has a lot of potential to be something special, but it lacks gestalt. In other words, the mechanics of the game don't all work together in a way that is overall satsifying. It's strength is possibly the art, and sound. But the gameplay mechanics are all over the place. 

For instance, when you die, you get absolutely nothing. Cool, perma death. But this is an RPG that "appears" to place high value on progression with a minimalistic skill "tree." Those don't really go together unless somehow the player is able to progress their character even though they're dying (again going to reference Dead Cells). Or like Rogue Legacy, the player gets something different on their next run that mixes it up a bit. 

Multiplayer technically works, but it was humorous at how ridiculously easy it was for us to die. The most exciting things were getting new loot/gear, etc. and then my fiend and I would die and lose it all. Not exactly fun when you do that several times in a row, and feeling jipped because you died as a result of not being able to make a jump that should be extremely easy to pull off. The jumping in this game isn't consistent nor fluid. 

I would like to see this game focus less on the procedurally generated levels and more on the core game, getting maybe 8-10 solid levels/themes built that are fun to play, before going into generating content that doesn't really feel much different than the other generated levels. Once those levels' themes and "hooks" are established, then I'd say you could generate variations of those levels. 

Anyway, best of luck to the developers as they finish up this game. It's not easy creating a game.

A brief fore-warning. This game takes time to warm up.

I strongly reccomend this game to anybody who is a hardcore gamer, or those well breifed in the ways of the rougelike. the game has fantastic content, an incredible combat system, and a well thought out online multiplayer. It has good controller support (Steam controllers too) and is fantastic on the keyboard as well. And if you dislike the game's default controlls, rebinding is quick and easy.
A list of reasons to play vagante:
-Active developers
-Stellar online multiplayer
-Fantastic replayability
-Smooth combat

However this game may not be for everybody:
-The graphics can make it hard to see things for those with bad vision
-The combat system, enemy AI, and skill trees take around time to learn (20 hours for me)
-There is little to no story
-The community is somewhat small (Not necessarily a bad thing)

Vagante is a game I will never forget, and playing online, I've made lifelong freinds. the game is full of challenges to keep things fresh, and is great for those who love perfecting their own special playstyle. The price tag may seem high, but the game is one that you can find hundreds of hours of content in.

31674774.review:
[h1] 2d side scrolling Dark Souls roguelike. [/h1]

Where do I start with this game? It's remarkable. There are so many good things about it, that it would be easier to just tell you what's wrong with it and end the review here by saying "Nothing". Unfortunately that wouldn't be a very useful review so I'll tell you what to expect from this game, since sadly, reviews have turned into people telling their personal story instead of what the game is like, what makes it good/bad, and why you should or should not get it. 

[h1] Graphics [/h1]

The game utilizes the classic retro sprite graphic look, and as someone who grew up on NES, this is something I can never get sick of. To be honest, given the games engine, the way the words are designed in addition to the enemies, etc, I think the game would actually look kind of bad if it tried to go for realistic graphics.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

This game plays like Castlevania had a baby with Dark Souls, and Castlevania had the recessive gene. You're going to walk side to side, and jump up and down platforms in order to get to the next level, where you're treated to a measly 4 hp out of around 80. There are 3 classes (People say 4? Maybe I haven't unlocked the 4th, so I can't speak to it) The Knight, The Rogue, and the Mage. The knight seems to have higher HP and higher defense, but has a slower swing of the sword. The rogue has a fast dagger stab, and can use a bow. The mage has the least amount of HP, and has a very weak melee attack, or as far as I can tell, an infinite amount of uses on their casting. 

For me, the rogue class seems the best, although the mage can be fun too. I find the knight to be very boring. 

[h1] What do you do? [/h1]

A horse and carriage walks up, and you select your class, and he jumps out of the carriage. You go inside the dungeon and you explore it searching either for the next door out, treasure chests, bosses (there seems to be 2 bosses on each level, and are optional, but do carry the keys to treasure chests), and then you move on to the next level. The combat is very good and responsive (I read a review saying the opposite and I wonder if perhaps it was an old review, because I found the game to be perfect in terms of responsiveness. 

The game is also extremely challenging, and it doesn't hand you anything. As far as I can tell, the only thing that gives you any health, is the 4 HP you get by sitting at the fire in between levels, so be very careful and plan every attack to the T. It's because of this, that this game reminds me of Dark Souls. 

Overall, this game is wonderful, and I think you would be foolish not to buy it if you're a fan of roguelikes. The only thing that does bug me about the game is the fact that I have no idea how the title is pronounced. Vuh gone tay?

31451726.review:
This game is really pretty, and in theory I should love it, but the permadeath roguelike concept is super hurt by how difficult it is to control your character. Most of the movements you make are clunky, and a great deal of combat is managing the awkwardness of your character, rather than maneuvering around the enemies.

Additionally, it seems (from my limited experience of the first two levels and about 50 deaths) that most of the game play elements are designed for long term play; identifiable items w/curses possible, random loot with interesting magic properties, etc. Except that this really works against the roguelike theme when at any time you might have a boulder auto kill you. Yes, I understand that there's a "git gud" factor, but the point I'm trying to make isn't that it *can't* be done, but that it's not *fun* to get good. 

Take Caveblazers as a counter point and very similar game (which is much uglier). When I die in Caveblazers, there's no mistaking in my mind that I died because I didn't play well. Even with spikes I often blame myself rather than the game. In Vigante when I die I feel like chucking my keyboard, because my character didn't do what I was trying to get him to do, often not turning to attack or jumping the wrong direction or not enough.

If I were to improve the game, I would make the character control muuuuch more responsive. Other than that I think the game would be really nice, but as it stands I regret my purchase.

31341382.review:
I love the concept and the underlying mechanics. A lot fo thought went into this early-access game. There are a few issues that make it unplayable for me. 

1) The visuals are very difficult for a 40+ gamer like myself. There's not enough on-screen contrast to see what is happening, especially with the type of pixel art that was chosen. Adjusting the brightness and scaling does little to help. The  (game ending!) traps on the floor feel unfair, because they are impossible to see.  Most of the time I feel like I am guessing what is happening on screen. It's not a fun or rewarding feeling.

2) A lack of tutorial is a major issue, especially considering how there is zero explanation given in-game on how to play.

3) The controls often feel unresponsive. I understand that it's trying to limit the speed of my attack, but it feels excessive and sluggish. A 25% increase in game speed would make a huge difference. 

These issues make Vagante less playable and enjoyable than the far inferior Bard's Gold. Not because it's not well thought out, but because Vagante is repeatedly vague and confusing.

I have no qualms with a game being difficult. However, please make the difficulty fair and rewarding by helping the gamer be aware of what is going on.

31334052.review:
Version played : 55c

This game is a fantastic Spelunky rogue-like with a great touch of class-based action/RPG elements.  The controls are super, super tight, and each class feels unique and enjoyable.  There is a wide variety of randomly-generated weapons, items, and armor, which lends to the "Rogue" feel, and the procedurally-generated dungeons offer a nice mix-up each time you play.

Some nitpicks: 
- The endgame content was, at the time of writing, a bit sparse.   The caves and forest, and to a lesser extent, their "locked path" alternatives, were both excellent and filled with lots of variety and nooks to explore.  The flooding forest tower is a really neat level as it adds some extra difficulty.  The cave ruins could use more enemy types and some balancing.  The forest ruins are unbelievably challenging, filled with all kinds of traps.
- However, the Rift (and the Factory) are both large, mostly empty spaces.  There's not much to them, at the moment.

These are just nitpicks, though, as I understand the game is still in Early Access, and there's lots more balancing and content to come, I'm sure.  I really look forward to seeing this game finished, as it's held my interest for literally tens of hours already!

It is extremely crisp, polished, and fun. Reeks of personal love project. Local play too, how many games have that? Each update is kickass to boot. Highly recommend.

31333185.review:
Great game, the multiplayer is where it's at.  Despite having only four character classes, the build variety is good; learning to use the items that the RNG gives you at each chest, and figuring out the tricks to beat each boss are both very satisfying processes.  Play careful and learn the game, but experiment: try bringing various objects to the exit; try out all of the shrines; try to get away with robbing the shop (hint: certain builds and equipment make this easy).  Learn not to take stupid risks and unnecessary damage, because it adds up.  Every class can be good.  Please note that even though the game is still in 'early access', it currently feels like a complete roguelike.

The game is detailed.  There are interesting environmental interactions of involving pushable blocks, elemental attacks, spikes and other factors.  To end the review, here are just two examples (minor spoilers):

1. As a Mage, I was running from an aggrivated shopkeeper.  I jumped over a pit of spikes, and worried he would clear it and keep chasing me, so I used the basic ice spell just before he could land on safe ground with me - he froze solid and fell straight onto the spikes.

2. In multiplayer, I was playing as a Knight while my friend played a Rogue.  She was new to the game, and ran under the dragon boss as it used its downward slam attack.  They both fell into water, inside a semi-enclosed U-shape open at the top.  My friend was panicked, but quickly realised that the dragon couldn't breathe fire underwater.  The water drained a little with every attempted fireball.  As luck would have it, my friend had equipped a helm with the 'underwater breathing' enchantment on it: she easily mauled the dragon with a dagger, yelling "YOU HAVE NO POWER HERE!"  Vagante has a lot of room for creative tactics like this, because the enchantment variety is so great.

Great game, I start it up to play over and over again. Even though this should be Early Access it does not feel like one. People looking for a Darksouls-Spelunky should love it, as it has alot of depth and good replayability.

... but in terms of coop, thanks to the nature of the game I doubt I will be able to play this with friends alot. TLDR is at the bottom.

The game is unforgiving at times and thats something I can stomach, other people might not. Even in the best situation with great gear it is easy to screw up and loose your progress over a small misstep. It is realy easy to get frustrated over this because there are quite alot of things in a level that just kill you instantly, esp. in the first area. 
In theory you can prevent any death and Coop even features a system of bringing dead people back or staying in the game after death as a skeleton. Still it is something that makes this game seem quite unaccessible for someone who tries the game for the first time or simply lacks platforming precision or dislikes twitchy - sometimes overloaded - controlls. 

TLDR: The entry level of player skills required to really enjoy this game is quite high.

30680753.review:
3人しかいない開発陣が細かくアップデートしてくれる、メトロイドヴァニアのローグライク。プレイヤーキャラクターは４クラス存在しており、各々の特性で様々なプレイングができる。

　基本的にはフロアにある宝箱を開け、装備を集めてボスを倒していくという単純なもの。しかし、やはりローグライク。きちんと探索をしないと装備が整わないが、探索しても良いのが出るとは限らない。だが、大したものが出なくても、慣れればノーダメージでボスを倒すことも十分可能だ。

　このゲームでは道中の雑魚やボスを倒す手段も豊富に存在する。
　
　あなたは雑魚普通に剣で倒してもいいし、即死の棘に誘導して落としてもいい。また、魔法や弓矢の飛び道具を使ってもいいし、素手で殴り倒してもいい。お楽しみのボスにはとっておきの爆弾を投げてつけてもいいし、溜めておいた呪文で凍らせてはめ殺すのも手だ！。装備が無いなら、道中に落ちてる箱を投げつけて倒すこともできる。もちろん勝てないと思えば無視して通り抜けてもいい。良い装備が手に入ったなら１，２発で倒すことも可能だ！

　そして、良い装備を手に入れる方法も様々だ。

　基本的には雑魚はアイテムを落とさず、宝箱から出てくる何かで身を固めていくことになるのだが、様々な種類の防具や武器、アクセサリーが出てくる。また、フロアには商店があり、雑魚が落としたお金で買い物もできる。・・・あぁ、お金を払わないって選択肢を、選ぶ人もいるだろうね。
　そうして手に入れた物は、色々な効果がついていて取捨選択が悩ましい。・・・もちろん微妙なのもたくさん出てくる。
　それは攻撃力は上がるが体力が下がる鎧だったり、STRマイナスだけどINTプラスの武器だったり。部位ごとにも特殊効果があるため、それらも考えると“うーん、要らないけど場合によっては使えるかも？”と捨てるに捨てられない。そして所持数量は決まっている。(たとえば三段ジャンプできるブーツに色々マイナス補正が入ってたりね！)


マルチプレイで友達とわいわいやるのも楽しいし、一人でハクスラを楽しんでもいい。オススメなゲームです。
私みたいに友人の頭に石を落として即死させちゃうことも出来るよ！
・・・故意じゃなかったんだ。

30259472.review:
I really want to like this game. There's a lot to enjoy, and for the most part it captures that feeling of adventure and permanent consequence well. It makes a really great first impression. But I think there are too many faults that hold it back from being enjoyable in the long term:

[h1]Hitboxes are all wrong[/h1]
For example, rods don't have anywhere near the range they appear to in their attack animation. Frequently you will miss hitting enemies even though the animation suggests that you should have hit them. This happens for upward swings of a sword as a knight as well, for instance. In a game where each mistake is brutal, these details matter. You miss an enemy due to shoddy hitboxes, and are then punished for it with hitpoint damage that is nigh impossible to recover. A difficult game is fine, but not when many mistakes are not your own.

[h1]Risk is discouraged[/h1]
Each level has a boss that is significantly tougher than the other enemies in the level-- in most cases, tougher than the entire level itself. The payoff for beating a boss and using their key to open a bonus chest is minor; two potions and a weapon seems to be the norm. Most of the time these potions are not beneficial, and the weapon is almost certainly not suited to your character class. The potential benefit to beating these bosses is so low in comparison to the damage you will likely take, that it's usually best to skip them. I've found there to be glitches sometimes where the boss will despawn! But usually, once you encounter them, you'll want to rush though the level to the end so you can escape.

This is a running theme through the game, where the best strategy is also the most boring: run through the level to the end. (This is much more of a problem in the later levels though.) This is not helped by the fact that the Level Up choices you get are all pretty useless. A stat bonus of +1 in this game does very little, and most of the special ability options are only somewhat beneficial. You require EXP to level up, which in turn requires killing enemies. In theory you'd think this would make a nice choice to take on more risk killing enemies for additional EXP. But in reality, after the first couple of Level Ups, you'll have the most important abilities and taking on further risk is just not worth it.

Whenever I play this game, I try to play it the fun way: killing lots of enemies. Not all of them, mind you. In the end, after the first couple of levels, I really have no choice except to run through them because [b]there's no reward the game will give me that is worth the risk of staying and fighting[/b]. Even if you find good loot, nothing will recover your health unless you get lucky with a healing potion or healing wand.

[h1]Recommendation[/h1]
I feel lukewarm about recommending this game. I can't honestly say it's good, despite the great first impression it has. Long term enjoyability matters to me in a game, and this game doesn't do it for me. It feels too unfair (i.e. bad hitboxes), and not rewarding enough (i.e. risk not rewarded).

It's quite possible to fix my complaints in the development of the game, but I doubt it will happen. The devs have found the shoddy hitboxes acceptable since I first bought the game, and apparently don't see fit to correct that. Seems like a pretty fundamental thing to me, and since they haven't bothered to fix it, I don't have faith that this game will ever improve enough to overcome its flaws.

30252306.review: Spelunky meets classic roguelikes, with a bit of Dark Souls and Zelda thrown into the mix.

30232367.review:
I honostly do not like Vagante, its a simple and repetetive boring slog through procedreal generated worlds that feel too similar to have any sort of true replayability, but before I get into the negetives lets look at some of the positives. 

Vagante has some very neat ideas for what it is, all the classes and spells are creative in some regards my favorites being the rougue and wilding which really push your abilities and challenge you. The gameplay feels smooth, the menues are easy to navigate and its pretty easy to get used to the controls. 

...That might be the end of it. 

Unfortanatly Vagante also has a wide variaty of problems with how it makes its characters despite them being so well built...as bases at least. What I mean is that these characters feel like bare bones representations of what could be a better start to the game. When you start, you have almost nothing, or at least for the wilding and rougue. Yes, I do know of how you are able to use one free point to unlock a new ability, abilities that can be further upgraded afterwards using the same points which are gained after leveling up, my problem is that the game makes you work for abilities that seem necessary. For example, the rougue has the rolling ability and the ability to move while shooting their bow which can be unlocked. However, I argue that the rolling should not only be immediatly available to you, but that it should also be given to all the characters. Rolling is increadibly useful in this game and I argue more importent the the primary weapon of the bow. Avoiding enemy projectiles and melee attacks by constantly jumping over them in a repetative pattern is not enjoyable, but rolling past them and avoiding their shots do. It adds a little complexitiy to the fighting, now by no means is the fighting in anyway complex in fact its pretty dull, but it was something and that something was something I thought should have been given across all the playable characters. 

Next, shooting while moving...why cant I have this at the very beggining? What kind of game is this where enemies are constantly moving, approaching me at a fast pace, and all I can do is sit there doing nothing? It doesn't compliment the level design, often a wall will block your shot so you will need to move, enemies will be above you but OH you can't jump or look up until, what, 2 levels in? Maybe the enemies are approaching me fast but oh no I can't move my lazy butt says I can't shoot arrows while moving backwards in a straight line. It makes the bow seem useless since often there isn't even enough space to shoot. A major problem for the Rougue. 

Now, the levels are boring. Im sorry but after 4 hours of playing through the first 3 levels and dying after the 3rd I just can't stand it. Sure you mey say, "Ugh, just get better nerd and you'll see all the rest of the levels"...but for a game that promotes proceedreal generating and replayability, should those first few levels not have some variaty and better design? Maybe make it a lush green field that goes into the cave, maybe replace the 2nd area (the forest) with the 1st (the caves) because its so drab and boring to just stare at that for 4 hours. 

You know what else is boring? The combat!

Its so simple, dodge, hit, dodge, hit, dodge. I mean the game has no variaty, again adding rolling to all characters and making it immediatly available could really spice it up, most enemies are too simple, they stab, and they're open. Sure this is in the first area but...the first area is 3 levels long, I expect something more like how bout less simple bandits and maybe a horde of tiny dragons that spew fire! How bout add lasers to the flying eyeball...things. I don't know but after maybe level 1 or 2 I expect more then a bandit and a flying eye that does nothing. 

And sure you may argue, well upgrading your abilities is importent to this kind of game, and I agree. But, im saying you should start me at the right point to start upgrading, between so overpowered it can kill the final boss and so weak I die in one hit kay?

Finally, this game is unfair in some respects. Or at least, with the campfires, which only heal 10 HEALTH. I mean granted, its a hard game, its your mistakes, deal with it. But when I complete a stage, I want to feel motivated not discouraged. A measaly 10 health is not going to be enough to make me charge back in. 

I can see why so many people love this game, but its just not for me.

30141898.review:
最高で３面の墓地まで進めていまだクリアが見えないがどんなゲームか大体わかってきたのでレビュー
まず私はアクションゲーム脳で、ある程度のアクション性を期待して買った　だがこのゲームにアクションゲームを期待すると痛い目をみる
あくまでも'アクション寄り'のローグライクなのである
どういうことかというと、常に罠による即死が見えるのと、こちらの体力に対して敵の一撃がかなり痛い
そしてそんな罠や痛い攻撃を避けながらちまちまと進めていくのだが、被弾して削られていく体力に反して体力の回復手段が限られておりかなり希少である
さらに各フロアには飛び道具ややたらと痛い攻撃を仕掛けてくるボスがおり、これはアクションの技量だけで突破するのはおそらく無理であり、アイテムの引き(主に飛び道具や魔法)とプレイヤースキル、そして最も重要なのが地形を利用したスタックであり、それらを駆使して倒せるか判断する必要がある
要は見える敵を全て倒していくアクションゲーム的なプレイは無理で、もし全て倒して進めようと思ったらかなりのアイテムの引きに加えてプレイヤーの腕前が試される
しかしフロアをクリアするだけなら雑魚すら倒さずとも良いのだ　じゃあ敵を全部避けていけばいいかというとそうではなく、敵を倒さねば経験値が得られず、最も安定したキャラの強化手段である「レベルアップによるスキルの習得」ができなくなってしまい、結果的に通路上にいる雑魚すら倒せなくなってしまう
この加減が絶妙なレベルで成り立っており、引くか突っ込むかの判断を大いに悩ませるのである　そして死にまくるのだ
そんな死にゲーだがこじんまりとまとまっているおかげでやたらとリプレイ性が高く、空いた時間でついついやりたくなる魔力がある
職業とスキル習得で色々なビルドで攻略を試せるのも面白く、本音を言うならもう少しマイルドな難易度でこのゲーム性を楽しみたかった

総評としてはローグライク好きでリプレイ性の高いゲームを求めているなら買い
まだアーリーアクセスだが非常に完成度が高く、これからの発展にも期待できる

30028091.review:
Game is awesome and it's on Linux. 

I purchased it a while back and played the DRM-Free verison on my computer until I decided to install it recently on steam.  

The game is a dungeon crawler and there are four classes (WIzard, Knight, WIldling, and Rogue). 

Typically you need to defeat a "boss" (Giant Centipede, Dragon, Warchief and etc) in order to advance to the next level and they drop a key to open a chest of goodies. 

There is an item shop that holds three different items that can be purchased and it can even be robbed if you can handle fighting the merchant. 

Easy to come across weapons that curse you, potions that lower your stats or posion you since you don't initally know the details of the item. 

There are scrolls that help with identifying items or the wizard has a skill that can.  

I find myself frequently playing this game when I need a breather from homework/studying. Games don't last too long when I have fallen on spikes, boulder smashes me, items drained my health, and etc.

I can see where people might feel that the content is limiting, but it's definitely worth a buy.

Игра должна понравиться игрокам которые имеют опыт в нажимании одних кнопок, т.к. это платформер, и играть со своей мышкой ты сможешь только в главном меню, остальное время игры ты будешь налаживать отношение с управлением. Отсутствует сюжет - игра заточена чисто под геймплей и атмосферу, т.к. игра в раннем доступе и она частенько обновляеться есть надежда на то что в скором времени появиться и сам сюжет. Отсутствует русский язык - это единственное что мне не понравилась, в игре имеется тучиво море различных итомов с различными свойствами на английском перевод которых ты точно не знаешь, но повторюсь, это еще ранний доступ, видно что игра требует многих доработак.

[list]
[*] TIGHT CONTROLS
[*] CHALLENGING GAMEPLAY
[*] UNFORGIVING MECHANICS
[*] WONDERFUL VISUALS
[*] TOUGH DECISIONS AT EVERY TURN
[*] GREAT TO PLAY WITH FRIENDS WHO ARE SICK OF THE GAMES OF TODAY THAT REWARD SLOPPY PLAYING

29546250.review:
ローグライク経験者なら当たり前なことだけど、運要素が絡んでくるゲームなので、何度もトライしながら「ああ、惜しかったのになあ！」と楽しめる人がやるべきなゲーム。
アイテム持ち越しはなしで、毎回ゼロからのスタート。だけどやり込むうちに「BACKGROUND」というキャラの特性（初期値で攻撃力が＋１など）が開放されていくので、死ぬのも無駄ではない。
キャラのスキルや特性、武器の間合いや、魔法の効果など、覚えてだんだん上手くなっていくゲームなのだが、攻略のために求められるプレイヤースキルがファミコン世代のソレなのでよい。
簡単に言えば、マリオやロックマンをやっていた頃のような操作感のアクションローグライクだ。

現在、僕はGoogle翻訳を片手にマルチプレイしかやってない。
「解呪の巻物ある？呪われちゃった！」など、Chatで意思疎通を図りながらダンジョンを進めるていくのが楽しい。
他の人のプレイはすごい参考になるし、「これはすごいアイテムだぜ！」など教えてもらえる。
FPSゲーやRTSのマルチみたいに「対戦要素」はなく、協力が求められるので罵り合うようなことがない点もすごく良いとおもう。
たまにマルチプレイのバグ（ブラックアウト）などが発生するが、それもプレイヤーのみんなで「畜生ー！開発者呼んでこい！」などと苦笑しながらやり過ごせるレベル。

個人的にSTEAMをはじめてから一番楽しんでいるゲームなので、価格設定としては安すぎるくらいだ。

Но со временем вы привыкаете к управлению, начинаете понимать что к чему и узнаете новые полезные трюки. Разнообразие геймплея обеспечено, есть 4 отдельных класса, каждому из которых можно выбрать свое прошлое, что обуславливает предметы, с которыми вы начинаете игру и то, какие бонусы вы получите. У каждого класса имеются свои навыки, которые можно прокачивать, и в зависимости от того, какой вы навык качаете, меняется и ваш стиль игры. Например разбойника можно сделать воином дальнего боя, стреляющим из луков/арбалетов и прочего, а можно превратить его в бесшумного убийцу, разящего врагов из невидимости в спину. Но это не мешает вам взять булаву, нацепить тяжелые доспехи и пойти бить по головам своих недругов из темного переулка :) Однозначно рекоммендую эту игру всем любителям платформеров и рогаликов, разработчики молодцы, стараются над игрой)

29507236.review: Great game, spent hours and hours and hours playing it with my friends. It's probably one of my favorite multiplayer games.

29277526.review:
First off, this is a fun and amazing game. Secondly There are many frustrating things that i hope change.

TL/DR version, needs real progession instead of being based off skill and luck. Please make the wizard better to start off so that he can make it to beast mode, some spells need more damage or make it so that they level up through use/ level up when you do.  not so many insta-death mechanics

The game is pure rogue like, feels 100% random, gone entire games as a knight without finding a damn sword. 

Things i have the major issues with are the insta deaths in the game. they are around every corner and force you to plan every action around every mob. which can get tedious, i like insta deaths just wish there wasn't 50 thousand things that caused them. One thing that could save grace from this in my next point.

Zero progression, The only "progression" you get is that you unlock backgrounds that may or may not be beneficial. they are very minor stat bumps, and you can only pick one. Beyond the first or second level of the dungeon you may even forget what background you started with.  I wish there was something, ANY thing that made the next run just a little bit easier, so that you could eventually consistantly dive to the deepest parts. even if that took 100 runs to get there it would be nice.  After getting through the later areas of the game and getting to the "you currently beat all available content" screen twice in one playthrough (i was very sad and irritated how i died that run)  I would like to be able to consitanly get that far again, but the insta deaths are too stronk and with no progression its sometimes based purely on luck and layout that you get that far.

Classes, the strongest two classes i've noticed are the knight and the rogue, the mage is next to useless considering how weak his starting spells/kit are and its purely random you'll get any spell book worth using. Now the magic that you can find in the game some of them are badass and would make the mage awesome, problem is getting them or getting lucky enough to get them. the other class just seems kinda meh... its a spoiler so i won't get into it here.

After almost 50 hours of play my runs can run anywhere from an hour and half to 1 minute, theres nothing that makes the game easier the longer you play except learning the enemies, and mastery of the bullshit. Its a hard game and i enjoyed the challenge but without any progression i'm ready to move on. 

Things i think could make it better.

Real progression. If i could choose to keep a piece of gear each run to use on my next run, that would be cool,
 if i could level up or upgrade my backgrounds, that would cool also. 
If i could save my character inbetween each level and slowly delve deeper and deeper with the level being random every time i had to go back to my save in solo play that would be amazing.

Attachment, you can't get attached to anything, like that sword? don't die then... like how this character is turning out? dont die... the perma death and loss of everything means that you start over fresh with that same shitty sword every run. I like to start from rags and get super powerful and do it all over again, but, without some ultimate goal to build torwards once you see the majority of the content and have beaten them once or twice it becomes super boring and not worth my time. something to attach your self to and build over time is what keeps me playing a game.

Over all my experience has been pleasurable, only reason i'm not recommending this right now is because i'd like to see some major updates to the wizard and over end goal of the game instead of just being a smack your face against the wall till you get lucky enough to get decent drops to make it to the final area.

29110479.review:
I really enjoy games like Vagante and I read the reviews and was looking forward to diving into a game with RPG elements that had difficulty and depth in a Rouge-like. 

The first time I booted it up I was playing local co-op with my two friends and we played for a while and struggled to really enjoy the game despite really fun mechanics, great art, and fantastic and rewarding boss battles. We kept dying and starting over until after about an hour and a half we quit. I wondered why the game got old so fast so I started running some solo games. 

10 deaths later I realized the full extent of the issue. Insta-deaths are difficult to balance properly due to the frustrating nature of them. Add perma-death and it becomes extremely difficult to properly manage, bordering on impossible. The way the Vagante developers have dealt with this is by putting instant death traps all over the place. This increases the difficulty by forcing you to pay constant attention, but also means that with one mistake or one unlucky knockback from an enemy you're dead. This is called artificial difficulty and it's a major flaw in any game, but Vagante suffers heavily from it by slapping you in the face with it over and over. 

Often games would start wonderfully and feel great due to the art and beating enemies and bosses, then the game would give you interesting loot and reward you for overcoming challenge after challenge, the you miss one pressure plate while fighting off multiple enemies and you die. There is no challenge failed, there is no rewarding glory of death in battle, there is only frustration that you made one mistake or took one bad risk and you ended your game that you otherwise loved.

Ultimately the mechanic is there to frustrate and increase difficulty and time of play, but it falls completely flat as insta-death mechanics so often do. It's unfortunate because the game is otherwise so interesting and fun to play. Until this changes the game is extremely noob unfriendly and frustrating.

9/10 with a reworked trap system, but as it is now I would suggest to all my friends to stay away until this changes.

28776702.review:
Okay, so whew, this is gonna be a long one but I think it needs to be written.
So, I prefer not writing what is essentially a review about a game until I manage to "beat" it. For games with no real end (Minecraft, Project Zomboid, Overwatch) this may be up until the point that I run out of things to do or have experienced everything it has to offer, everything being relative to what the makers put in, not mods. With 28 hours logged into this game from periodic play over roughly three years (I know, a tiny ammount in reality but the game has only just become fairly stable in terms of updates and much of my other time, much to my regret, is with a pirated version from a friend) I have finally "Beaten" Vagante. For those whom would like a short version in order to inform their decision to buy it or are just curious here it is: Don't waste your time on Vagante (at least for now).

Now Before Fan Boys (or Girls) get up my ass about how I'm wrong here's a slightly longer version: Vagante is a great game that I love but I could never and would never recommend to anyone to play, not even the coarse, experienced, and highly skilled Rogue-Like player. Here's why I feel that way.

Me and my good friend love, I mean really LOVE Rogue-Likes. So much so that we created a kind of "Expectations" or "Guide" to what makes a game a great Rogue-Like.

[olist]
    [*] The game should start you off weak and easily killable, but with the tools you need either to fight back or avoid conflict.
    [*] The game should offer players some way to get stronger without minimizing the level of danger
    [*] The game should constantly offer increasingly dangerous odds without ever elevating to the point of immposibility or pixel perfection mind sets
    [*] Players should, to some level, want to seek out danger. If players never want to leave their realitive saftey then it is showing of a lack of enough of a reward incentive when approching risk.
    [*] Players must be forced into learning how to both think thoroughly and on their toes, that way every encounter is a test of skill and reason, and thus their ability to face these test should never be based on luck such as whether or not they pick up a certain item early or late.
    [*] And most  importantly every death, and I mean every death, should be the players fault, whether that means they did not understand the danger they were in, were too reckless, or they did not have the skill to go through the encounter they approched willingly. This should be done without limiting styles of play or creating a "meta" where only some characters are viable.
[/olist]

Now, while this is only our opinions when it comes to these games we think each of these offer a valid point in mind, and thus have only given one game full checks on this ever: Risk of Rain, a game which we have a combined total from online play to local of over 200 hours, a disgustingly large number compared to every other Rogue-Like we've played. So, why do I bring all of this up? Well, because Vagante easily fails four of these, specifically, the four ladder most checks. To clarify lets start with three. The game [b] starts	[/b] with Pixel Perfect Mind Sets i.e. the jumping puzzle before you ever enter the dungeon which nets you the nimble quirk. It's one of many instaces of honestly ridiculous odds. For four from experience with personal play time and online playing no one ever wants to seek out anything truely dangerous for the sole fact that even a little loss of life can spell doom when going into the next level and those that due are often the bane of the part and the precieved reason for failure i.e. the wildling is reckless and draws too many enemies out, then dies causing us to have to rez them or causing us to die and they being unwilling to rez. Bosses (especially in the later half of the game) are typically too much of a bother and the game shifts from a dungeon crawl to a full on hell sprint where the focus moves from slowely taking ones time to trying to rush through without getting hit or fighting to the exit. For five there have been countless games where the only reason I got as far as I did was because I picked up a really strong item early game. Even for my winning game my party and I only made it through because we were blessed with Vit items early on and traded them back and forth while running through. Sure, it forced us to work together and I enjoyed being the hero of the day dishing out stolen vit item we found but the fact that we would have died without it was generally sucky. And finaly number six, easily the most important rule of thumb and too the biggest failure. While many deaths in Vagante are player driven, an equal amount are total and utter Bullshite. To elaborate there are often many games that have ended not due to a player mistake or recklessness but instead and unfair  gimmick (as I refuse to call such things mechanics). Case and point my winning game. My party and I all sit at the bonfire wary but sure of ourselves. I've been pumping shadow to full, and giving myself one point in daggers and archery for better overall dmg. Since looping I've also pushed my Vit up four times and my elusive play style has rewarded me with 120 health points and a full bar along with snazzy armour and some really good weapons, plus some health items to boot. I feel like the hero of the game, my party only barely surviving our inital run thanks to some unfun but well meaning tactics of "Dont't fight, just run, and if you die twice use your skull to find the exit and then lead everyone there". The enemies are stronger but so are we and our team work is nearly flawless. We make our way into the Spirit Forest once more killing the shopkeeper with ease and exploring while loot gathering. The boss is the Plant Monster, my party dives into the fray, with me bringing up the rear. We avoid the plant head though every now and then we're hit but the damage is low thanks to defense and poison resist. everything is going well until BAM, I'm caught and the plant head dives underground with me in it and I get insta-killed. The same happens to our mage and me again when I reform as a skeleton. 118 health (I took a little dmg) to zero, just like that. How is that fair? Where is the test of skill or trial of battle? There was none. I and my teammate were simply killed to an unfair gimmick. The party survived the encounter but my paitence did not and I gave up all of my items, told my new mates fairwell, and now we're here.

Now, I realize that Vagante is still early acess but as is I just can't recomend this game to anyone. I love the art style of the game, looking like a 2d version of my dream game. The score is beautiful composed really setting the mood for the game. The RPG elements are spot on being easily understandable but still complex enough to show off your custom version of classes. Combat, while simple, is for the most part engaging. Crafting is simple and fun to do as minecraft, even though there is little of it. However, with all that said I just can't forgive these other issues. When an entire group of veteran players tell you to run past hard to reach content instead of enjoy it as you would other areas it's extreamly telling of what kind of problems the game has. Again, as is, I can't say I would recomend Vagante nor would I really even play it anymore if I had more options (You win this time developers. I've had and played this game far too long to refund it.) but alas I'm a poor college kid and don't, yet even still I can't say I'll be playing much for a while. Developers, if your reading this please, don't take any of what I'm saying spietfully. I love this game and would like, no, I need you to take this as constructive feedback. I wan't to explore the catacombs and rift as thoroughly as I do the Dark Caves, not run through them barely able to distguish things as I make a mad dash for the exit. It's not fun.

28588280.review:
2014년 12월 스팀에 입점한 이 작품은 현재까지도
꾸준한 업데이트를 통해 게임에 덧살을 붙여나가며
현재, 거의 완성단계에 도달한 로그라이크  게임이다.

본인이 로그라이크 장르를 많이 해보지 못한관계로
다른 게임들을 비교하며 설명하기는 어려우나,
이 게임을 즐겼던 많은 유저들은 '스펠렁키' 에 멀티플레이와
장비수집, 기술습득과 같은 RPG의 요소를 가미한 게임이라 평하고 있다.
이 게임이 어떤 느낌인 감이 올 수 있는 평인듯 싶다.



[h1] 좋았던 점	[/h1]

- 특색있는 4가지 직업과 랜덤으로 나오게 되는 아이템들, 효능들로 다회차의 재미를 꾸준히 유지
- 고전게임처럼 숨겨진 요소들이 많아, 하나 하나씩 찾아내는 재미가 쏠쏠
- 플레이어와 멀티를 통해 협동 가능(최대 4인) 
- 함정을 피해다니며, 보스들을 격파해나가는 도전적인 난이도가 매력적
- 아담한 용량과 낮은 요구사양
- 스팀 포럼에 상주하며 피드백을 받고, 답변을 주는 개발자(덤으로 게임 내 힌트도)


[h1] 별로인 점	[/h1]

- 던전이 생성될때 물체나 몹, 보스의 배치는 늘 바뀌지만, 맵은 랜덤생성이 아님.
  그나마 여러 맵들이 준비되어 있지만, 수 시간 내에 똑같은 맵을 몇번이고 만나게됨
- 진행구성은 중간에 지하무덤으로 가지 않는한 변함이 없음. (동굴 -> 숲 -> ??? -> ??? )
- 게임 내 설명이 거의 없기에, 이런 불친절함에 당황해 할 수도 있음
- 불편하고 뻣뻣한 조작감. 캐릭터 모션
- 16.12.24 현재 게임은 미완성이라 버전이라, 게임엔딩도 없고 최종보스도 없음.


위에서 언급하였듯이, 이 게임의 단점과 장점은 정보부재에서 나오기도 한다.
이 점 덕에, 플레어이는 마치 모든것이 미스테리들로 가득했던
고전게임들을 하듯이 게임 내에 개발자가 감쳐둔 비밀들을 하나 둘씩
알아내며  흥미를 붙여나갈 수 있기도 하지만,
게임 내 접하게 되는 랜덤 요소와 조합,  사용법에 대한 정보가 없어
초보자들은 이런 불친절함에 게임 초반을  넘기지 못하고 방황할 수 있는 문제가 되기도 한다.
ex) 독 포션은 '적용'버튼을 눌러 무기에 바를 수 있지만, 게임 내엔 아무런 설명이 없다.
    심지어 개발자도 이 사실을 몰랐으면 했는데 라는 반응의 댓글을 달기도.

결국 포럼이나 위키를 찾아봐야 하는데, 그렇게 되면 게임의 재미가 급감하기 때문에
공략을 선택할 것인가 게임의 재미를 중시할 것인가 대한 딜레마에 빠지기 쉽다.

그 외의 문제는 게임이 미완성이라, 수백번의 죽음을 거쳐 게임에 익숙해진뒤에
게임의 위험들을 헤쳐나간뒤 끝에 도달한 순간, 축하 메세지 이외에
아무것도 없었다는점. 개인적으로 허무함을 감출 수 없었다. 

그래도 게임은 거의 완성단계에 도달한것으로 보이며
현재는 마지막 부분 추가작업과 직업간의 밸런스 조절, 함정 추가 정도가 이루어지고
있기에 정식 출시를 기대해봐도 되지 않을까 생각해본다.

같이 할 친구가 있다면 서로 어려운 난이도에 처절함을 맛보며
게임을 진행해나가는 재미가  상당할듯 싶은데
혹여나 같이 게임을 해볼 친구가 있다면 이 게임도
나쁜 선택은 아닐것이다.

I don't regret buying this game; but in the way of it being early access, here's what you need to worry about. Control placement on the keyboard is fairly awkward, and there are few if any tutorials on how to effectively use the keys and available actions. The majority of the bosses, at this phase, are extremely difficult to defeat. Variations in the early dungeons are minimal, and it can get a bit jading. Death sends you back to the beginning, by which I mean (literally) the character select, and drops everything other than achievements.

It's on its way to becoming something great, but it is not there yet; if you do purchase, remember that this is still in a very early phase of development.
